page.title: 05The Church Irthlingborough
page.content: St. Peter's Church is a beautiful building mainly built of sandstone and ironstone which gives it a lovely warm glow. It is built in the normal cross shape but there is a separate tower which is very unusual. In the 14th century, the church was bought by John and Joan Pyel and inside are monuments to them both in alabaster panelled tombs with their effigies on the top,both are in the side chapel named after them. These monuments were once richly and lavishly emblazoned with gold and flowers. It is believed that they were desecrated by rebel Roundheads in the 17th century. The church has a set of beautiful stained glass windows which give a ray of colour to the interior of the church.
